ruling_link_text: Cherry-picked number that lacks key context

statement: "Obamacare adds trillions to our deficits and to our national debt."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney says 'Obamacare' adds trillions to the deficit
ruling_link_text: Not supported by evidence

statement: "Gov. Romney was very clear, he would veto the DREAM Act."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney said he would veto the DREAM Act, says David Plouffe
ruling_link_text: No backing off from primary comments

statement: "When Mitt Romney was governor, Massachusetts ... (had) more debt per person than any other state in the country."
ruling_headline: Barack Obama ad says Mitt Romney was No. 1 in state debt as Mass. governor
ruling_link_text: Figure is correct, but lots of context is missing

statement: "As Governor: Romney did not keep public safety funding in line with inflation."
ruling_headline: Democratic SuperPAC ad blasts Romney record on funding law enforcement
ruling_link_text: Most calculations show an increase

statement: "Romney outsourced call center jobs to India."
ruling_headline: Obama ad says Romney outsourced Massachusetts jobs
ruling_link_text: He declined to ban outsourcing in Mass.

statement: As governor of Massachusetts, "Romney reduced unemployment to just 4.7 percent."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney says he reduced Massachusetts unemployment to 4.7 percent
ruling_link_text: It did fall that far, but Romney doesn't get all the credit

statement: "More Hispanics have fallen into poverty under Obama."
ruling_headline: Romney ad says more Hispanics are in poverty since Obama took office
ruling_link_text: Recession, not Obama, mostly to blame

statement: "When Mitt Romney was governor, Massachusetts lost 40,000 manufacturing jobs, a rate twice the national average."
ruling_headline: Barack Obama ad says manufacturing jobs fared worse in Massachusetts under Romney
ruling_link_text: A stretch to blame Romney for decades-long manufacturing decline

statement: Under Gov. Mitt Romney, Massachusetts ranked "47th in job creation."
ruling_headline: David Axelrod repeats claim that Massachusetts under Mitt Romney ranked 47th in job growth
ruling_link_text: Right on stats, but bigger forces beyond Romney
statement_context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"

statement: "When it comes to what little bit of job creation was happening in Massachusetts (when Mitt Romney was governor), it was happening in the public sector at six times the rate that it was happening in the private sector."
ruling_headline: O‚ÄôMalley criticizes Massachusetts job growth under Romney
ruling_link_text: Only true for state government
statement_context: an appearance on Meet the Press

statement: Says under Mitt Romney, "Medicare could end as we know it, leaving Julia with nothing but a voucher to buy insurance, which means $6,350 extra per year for a similar plan."
ruling_headline: Barack Obama's 'Life of Julia' says Mitt Romney would replace Medicare with ‚Äònothing but a voucher‚Äô
ruling_link_text: UPDATE: Based on outdated GOP plan
statement_context: a graphical tool on the campaign website

statement: When Mitt Romney was governor of Massachusetts, "we didn’t just slow the rate of growth of our government, we actually cut it."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney said he "actually cut" spending as Massachusetts governor
ruling_link_text: Spending increased by about 5 percent a year on his watch

statement: On President Barack Obama’s stimulus
ruling_headline: Did Mitt Romney flip-flop on the economic stimulus?
ruling_link_text: Supported "stimulus," not "the stimulus"

statement: On the Troubled Asset Relief Program (TARP)
ruling_headline: Did Mitt Romney flip-flop on TARP?
ruling_link_text: His view has been nuanced and consistent

statement: On gun policy
ruling_headline: Did Mitt Romney flip-flop on gun control?
ruling_link_text: In his current rhetoric, no sign of earlier support for restrictions

statement: On support for Ronald Reagan's policies
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney once distanced himself from Ronald Reagan, but no longer
ruling_link_text: He once distanced himself, but no longer

statement: On signing a no-tax pledge
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney rejected state tax pledge before signing national one
ruling_link_text: Rejected a state pledge; later signed a national one

statement: After they bought GST Steel, "Mitt Romney and his partners loaded it with debt, closed the Kansas City plant and walked away with a healthy profit, leaving hundreds of employees out of work with their pensions in jeopardy."
ruling_headline: Obama ad claims Romney, Bain left misery in wake of GST Steel takeover
ruling_link_text: Steel plant's fortunes tanked under Bain

statement: There are "49 different federal job training programs that report to eight agencies."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney said there are "49 different federal job training programs that report to eight agencies"
ruling_link_text: GAO report says similar

statement: On abortion
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney evolved significantly in his position on abortion
ruling_link_text: He's acknowledged a change of heart

statement: On whether humans contribute to global warming
ruling_headline: On Mitt Romney and whether humans are causing climate change
ruling_link_text: Mostly consistent, with one exception

statement: On support for gay marriage.
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney has maintained consistent stance on same-sex marriage
ruling_link_text: Moderate on some gay issues in 1994, but not same-sex marriage

statement: Says Mitt Romney would deny gay people the right to adopt children.
ruling_headline: Obama ad says Romney opposes gay adoption
ruling_link_text: Romney's own words say otherwise

statement: Says Mitt Romney "has refused to say whether he would have vetoed or signed the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act."
ruling_headline: 'Life of Julia' says Romney refused to say if he would sign equal pay law
ruling_link_text: Romney said he won't change law
statement_context: a graphical tool on the campaign website

statement: Mitt Romney has "proposed cutting his own taxes while raising them on 18 million working families."
ruling_headline: Obama says Romney would cut his own taxes while raising others‚Äô
ruling_link_text: Outside analysis bears him out

statement: Says Mitt Romney is proposing a "tax cut that gives an average of $250,000 to every millionaire in this country."
ruling_headline: Barack Obama says Mitt Romney's tax plan gives millionaires an average tax cut of $250,000
ruling_link_text: An independent number-cruncher agrees

statement: "We should be seeing numbers in the 500,000 jobs created per month. (Creating 115,000 jobs, the total from April 2012) is way, way, way off from what should happen in a normal recovery."
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney says creating 500,000 net jobs a month is historically 'normal'
ruling_link_text: 500,000 not "normal," but pace under Obama is subpar

statement: Says Mitt Romney's comments indicated he would not have pursued Osama bin Laden.
ruling_headline: Obama ad says Mitt Romney's view on killing bin Laden was 'it's not worth moving heaven and earth'
ruling_link_text: Romney had more to say

statement: Says Mitt Romney’s top five donors are Wall Street firms, while Barack Obama’s top five are technology companies and universities.
ruling_headline: Facebook post says Romney's top donors come from Wall Street, Obama's from tech and academia
ruling_link_text: The donors on the list are pretty accurate, but they aren't described correctly
